In this case, you will keep using the

When building a trigger, the only required field is

. However, as many websites employ it, Cloudflare has this automatic translation layer that converts it to
Cloudflare Zaraz allows you to track the actions your users are taking on your website and other events that might happen in real-time.

Common user actions you will probably be interested in tracking are Successful Signups, CTA clicks, and Purchases, among others. Common examples for other types of events are tracking the impressions of specific elements on a page, or loading a specific widget.
To start tracking events, add the Events API JavaScript code to your website. The following is an example for tracking purchases:

Only the first parameter is required. This parameter should be a string specifying the name of the event you want to track. The second parameter is an optional free-form object that can be used to send an additional set of key-value properties. For example, if the
you are tracking is "purchase", this object can include
. You choose what you want to track.
After using the Events API in your website to track an action:

Cloudflare Zaraz offers system properties that you can use when configuring the dashboard. They are helpful to send data to a third-party tool or to create triggers as they have context about a specific user's browser session and the actions they take on the website. Here is a full list of the System properties, how can you access them, and their values:
Returns URL query params from the
Returns the full URL from the
Returns the document character encoding from
Returns cookies obtained from the browser
Returns the visible web page area in user’s device.
Returns the type of browser engine (for example, WebKit).
Returns the version of the browser’s engine.
Returns the version of the operating system.
Returns the type of device used (for example, iPhone).
Returns a random number unique to each request.
Returns the name of the event sent using the Events API. Refer to
You can add new third-party tools and load them into your website through the Cloudflare dashboard.

Choose a tool from the tools library page and

page to configure the new tool. The information you need to enter will depend on the tool you choose.

and give your Event a name.

Your tool is now configured. The Event you have created will load the tool into your website when the conditions you set are met. Every Event includes:
. The name of the event that will be used internally by Cloudflare Zaraz.
. A set of rules that trigger an event, like
. (When applicable) Configure the type of data you wish to send to the new tool.
If you go back to the main Cloudflare Zaraz page, you will see your tool listed under
, and the name of the Event associated with it. In this page you can also click the
toggle to enable or disable your tool.

Cloudflare Zaraz (beta) gives you complete control over third-party tools and services for your website, and allows you to offload them to Cloudflare's edge, improving the speed and security of your website. With Cloudflare Zaraz you can load tools such as analytics tools, advertising pixels and scripts, chatbots, marketing automation tools, and more, in the most optimized way.
Cloudflare Zaraz is built for speed, privacy, and security, and you can use it to load as many tools as you need, with a near-zero performance hit.

Triggers are a set of conditions you can use to determine if and when Cloudflare Zaraz should send events to third-party tools. In most cases, your objective will be to capture specific site actions that are relevant to your business. In this case, a trigger will usually be based on an action the end user has taken on your website. That action will then be passed to Cloudflare Zaraz using the Events API or the
. For example, when a user clicks a button, you can use the Event API to track this activity and use it as a trigger to send events to specific tools.
For most tools, the trigger will be a simple
event type, for which Cloudflare Zaraz offers a

preset configuration. If this is the case for the tool you are choosing, you do not need to do anything else. For example, with the tool Facebook Pixel, you just need to add your account ID and Zaraz will configure the event for you.
, and select your account and website.
Enter a descriptive name for the trigger.

Your trigger is now complete. If you go back to the main page you will see it listed under

To start using Cloudflare Zaraz, log in to the

and add a third-party tool or service to it. You also need to create the Event that will activate the loading of the tool in your website, and the trigger, or set of conditions, to determine if and when Zaraz should send events to the tool.
If your tool just needs a
event as a trigger, go to
to get started. If you need a different kind of trigger or set of triggers, go to

All configurations and triggers are accessible from the dashboard. If you need more complex integrations, Cloudflare Zaraz provides a unified set of functions to send data programmatically to third-party tools. Regardless of the tool you need to use,
will send your data wherever you choose, without even needing to load the tool’s script.

headings.value: Send Events to a third-party tool

children.value: Send Events to a third-party tool

Events are bundles of information Zaraz sends to a third-party tool when a particular trigger is matched. To start using them, first create a trigger that determines the condition for which the event is sent. If you have already
, follow these steps to create an event.
, and select your account and website.
, select the third-party tool you want to send an Event to — for example, Facebook Pixel or Google Analytics.
, you can find a list of events currently sent to the tool you chose. Clicking the links in each Event shows you more details about the conditions associated with it. To add a new Event, click
Give the event a descriptive name. Depending on the tool, you may need to configure additional settings.
field, choose the relevant trigger you
. You may choose more than one trigger for your Event. If you choose more than one trigger, the event will be sent to the third-party tool only when all the selected triggers are matched.
Depending on the tool, you may also choose an
. The options you can fill out in
will depend on the tool you are configuring.
The new event you created will appear in the third-party tool, in the
